column4: hi all. I've just installed edgy on my pc and x doesn't start. my LCD says 'input not supported'
probably it is set to a refresh rate out of range for the monitor
i takeit the live cd worked?
yes, set the modelines to a sensible default
or find out what your monitor supports and set to that.. the resolution is probably out of range not the refresh rate sorry
yes, if it's an LCD then I am pretty sure that setting is mostly meaningless
the refresh rate
the default resolution is set to 1280x1024?
do you have a second monitor at all you can plug in to diagnose the problem?
what file system did you choose for the / filesystem?
in that case (i really hate to suggest it) you can boot to windows and mount the ext filesystem to edit the files if you have win installed
but lets leave that one for a while
how? if your screen doesnt come on?
ok
do you have the nvidia driver installed?
if xorg says nv then your not using the proprietry driver
why are you talking in html?
turn off the html output..
sorry i don't know much about installing nvidia drivers.. if you ahve it properly installed then you should be ableto change the "nv" to "nvidia" in xorg.conf to make it work
the nvidia driver should handle it better.. have you tried the nvidia driver? (NOT "nv"
try startx on its own
gdm might mess up if there are problems
and startx gives more informative output
